item.title: Static Linked List - Another Way To Represent Graphs
item.author: Author
item.description: Static Linked List is a data structure that stores linked list in static arrays. It is usually used to represent graphs. It is very interesting that its Chinese name literally translated as “Linked Forward Star”. You have two choices of paths to understand this. Start from Forward Star. Start from Adjacency List. However, I would recommend to explore both ideas to have a better understanding.

item.title: POJ 3268 Silver Cow Party
item.author: Author
item.description: There are one cow from each \(N\) (\(1 \le N \le 1000\)) farms want to go to the number X farm to have a party, hurrah! One cow from each farm need to go to the party and go back. There are \(M\) (\(1 \le M \le 100,000\)) weighted (represents time) one-direction roads connects pairs of roads. Cows are smart though, they want to go via the shortest path. The question is, what is the longest time the cow will take.
